_prev_prog_3.Description: The prevention program for the K-2 process consists of employee training and participation, active and passive mechanical and chemical controls, procedures, maintenance programs, and compliance audits designed to identify and mitigate conditions that could lead to an accidental release of a regulated substance. This program requires that all employees, including outside vendors working on-site, be trained in the proper way to conduct work on systems containing regulated substances.  The elements of the prevention program are reviewed at regular intervals to make sure that the program reflects of the needs of the latest process configuration.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
May 2014

Risk Management Plan                                    

Executive Summary





The Risk Management Program at the Arclin USA, Inc., Springfield, Oregon facility, incorporates a Risk Management Plan that assimilates the following elements:



Health, Safety, Environment, and Quality Policy;

Arclin's long-term development is secured through the way we handle Health, Safety, Environmental, and Quality matters. This policy is our basis to build trust between Arclin and our stakeholders. We will at all times strive to

- Ensure that health and safety are our first priority.

- Minimize harmful environmental impacts.

- Base our work on openness and continuous improvement.

- Develop products, services, & operations with consistent quality, which are environmentally preferred and safe.

- Implement this policy according to health, safety, environment & quality management systems based on ISO or equivalent standards.  



Facility Information;

The primary activities at the Arclin USA Springfield site are the production of formaldehyde solution and the production of proprietary thermosetting resins which are used primarily in wood adhesives applications. Formaldehyde is produced in a continuous process from methanol. The maximum quantity of formaldehyde in storage in one vessel is 50,000 gallons at a concentration of 52% by weight. Aqua ammonia is used in the resin production process. The maximum quantity of aqua ammonia stored in one vessel is 104,580 lbs at a concentration of 30% by weight. Resins are produced in batch operations and are shipped to customers by truck.



Accidental Release Prevention Program;

All PSM covered processes at the Arclin Springfield site are in Program 3 and meet the requirements of the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) program.  The existing OSHA PSM-required accidental release prevention program meets nearly all RMP requirements.  Where the programs differ, the Arclin program elements have been modified to incorporate RMP issues.  An example would be
